soft_skills.original_phrase: Strong product judgment with the ability to frame ambiguous problems into actionable plans
Excellent communication skills with engineers, designers, GTM teams, customers, and executives
You'll work closely with engineering, data science, design, GTM teams, and customers
Lead product launches with clear GTM narratives tied to customer ROI
Ability to balance strategy with hands-on execution
Partner deeply with engineering and AI teams

experience_requirements.requirement: 4+ years of experience as a Product Manager or Technical Product Manager
Experience building or owning AI-powered product features (GenAI, ML, automation, decision systems)
Technical or engineering background strongly preferred
Experience in B2B SaaS, vertical SaaS, or workflow-heavy products is a plus
Proven experience owning products from idea to launch to measurable impact

education_requirements.requirement: MBA from a premier institute is a plus, but product judgment matters more

key_responsibilities: Own AI-enabled product areas end-to-end, from problem definition to measurable business outcomes
Define when to use AI vs rules, heuristics, or workflow design based on customer value, cost, and reliability
Translate customer problems into clear product strategy, success metrics, and execution plans
Partner deeply with engineering and AI teams on Model selection and orchestration (build vs buy), Accuracy, latency, cost, and failure modes, Human-in-the-loop vs automated decisioning
Design guardrails, evaluation metrics, and fallback experiences for AI features
Build and maintain prioritized product backlogs aligned to outcomes (ARR, conversion, retention, productivity)
Lead product launches with clear GTM narratives tied to customer ROI
Use data and experimentation to validate impact and iterate quickly
Act as the voice of the customer, especially low-tech SMB operators and frontline staff
achievement_language: directly impact revenue, conversion, retention, and operational efficiency
shipping scalable solutions from concept to adoption
build products that move real business metrics
company_context: Zenoti provides an all-in-one, cloud-based software solution for the beauty and wellness industry (salons, spas, medspas, fitness studios). Unicorn company ($1 billion+ valuation), powers 30,000+ locations in 50+ countries, raised $80M from TPG, Great Place to Work Certified.
job_level: Mid-level Product Manager (4+ years experience required)
cultural_signals: move real business metrics, not just features
empowering people to feel good and find their greatness
